alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 4:25AM EST until February 12 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Wet snow expected in the higher elevations near the Virginia border with a mix of rain and snow elsewhere. Total snow accumulations of around an inch are expected, generally above 2000 feet. As much as 1 to 3 inches of snow could occur on the taller ridges above 2500 feet, with isolated higher amounts of 5 plus inches possible on the top of Black Mountain. The heaviest snowfall rates, some of which could approach an inch per hour, will occur during the afternoon. * WHERE...Bell, Harlan, Letcher and Pike Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 6 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions especially on the higher mountain passes. Higher elevation locations that see the heavy wet snow could also have tree damage that may affect powerlines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow could impact the higher elevation roadways, especially those near and above 2500 feet, including US-119 and US-421 crossing Pine Mountain, portions of KY-179 between Cumberland and Louellen, portions of KY-160 in Harlan County, and KY-38 in Harlan County.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Kentucky can be found by visiting https://goky.ky.gov.
